job_description: Data Analyst - job post Valiant Enterprises LLC Dallas, TX 75243 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Description: Data Analyst This is a high impact and exciting position that will assist in the development and support for Valiant BI, an internal & external platform used by Valiant Residential & their clients. This individual will be responsible for shaping the future of this platform in close collaboration with the senior leadership team. This individual will extensively utilize their Power BI & Python skills to further develop the Valiant BI platform into a scalable and performant cross-BU analytics platform. More specifically, this role will be accountable for oversight and delivery of data visualization, aimed toward delivering insights for fast and accurate, fact-based decision making. This requires identifying and understanding key issues, strong analytical thinking, the ability to conduct quantitative analysis and develop conclusions based on analysis/research. Key Responsibilities Implement robust, reliable and custom reporting and visualizations using Power BI Develop and maintain self-service reporting solutions and/or automated solutions Use SQL as main tool for data preparation: extracting, cleansing, aggregation, and summarizing data to create meaningful visualizations Participate in the design and implementation of logical and physical data models Review proposed production changes to ensure highest quality data standards and lowest production impact Navigate, understand, and leverage existing complex data structures for reporting Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through models, charts, graphs, and dashboards Maintain, update, and distribute client-facing and internal dashboards that track multifamily analytics and Key Performance Indicators Support production BI solutions by monitoring and tuning SQL queries and data loads Addressing user questions concerning data integrity Monitoring performance and communicating functional and technical issues proactively Interact with senior management, department leaders and other employees to develop and reach agreement on reporting requirements and priorities Coordinate system development with IT to enhance automation and visibility Requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Finance, Statistics, Engineering). 2+ year work experience designing, developing, publishing and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI Critical Skills Extensive knowledge of Data Analysis Expressions (DAX), Power Query formula language (M), and SQL Understanding of source systems, ETL tools, SQL processes to build & debug the sources of visualization data. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information quickly Predictive modeling techniques and statistics using Python, Machine Learning, AI, NLP experience is a plus Power Automate experience is a plus Additional Knowledge and Skills Proven ability to handle multiple projects while meeting deadlines and documenting progress towards those deadlines High initiative, drive, and energy, self-confidence, and results driven. Ability to quickly grasp business challenges and drive positive change. Able to work effectively in a team environment with little or no supervision Expert in requirements gathering skills, and solving business issues through data-related tools Real estate experience / multifamily industry knowledge is a plus If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

GIS Data Solutions Analyst I - job post North Central Texas Council of Governments 23 reviews Arlington, TX 76011 • Hybrid remote $48,030 - $57,636 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $48,030 - $57,636 a year Job Type Full-time Are you looking to join an award-winning organization with a culture built on innovation and public service? Are you looking for a position that offers a hybrid work schedule with work from home options? The Transportation Department of the North Central Texas Council of Governments is seeking entry-level GIS/Data Solutions Analysts to support the Transportation Department’s GIS and Data Solutions team. This position will assist with various activities and initiatives that further the team’s mission to organize, analyze, and disseminate data in support of data-driven transportation planning processes. Specific tasks will include assistance with data creation, analysis, and synthesis activities using appropriate software; creating and maintaining static and dynamic, interactive mapping products; and assistance with the automation of repetitive tasks using a basic knowledge of appropriate scripting languages. Applicants wishing to be considered for this position should apply online at https://www.nctcog.org/Careers. To be considered for any other NCTCOG position that may currently be open, applicants need to apply online separately for those postings. All submittals should include a cover letter summarizing work experience, as well as a current resume. The North Central Texas Council of Governments is currently permitting employees to work a hybrid schedule that consists of working part of each week in the NCTCOG offices in Arlington, Texas, and part of each week remotely from home within the Dallas-Fort Worth Region. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following: Using specialized GIS software such as ArcGIS for creation, maintenance, and visualization of specialized geographic datasets Using specialized data analysis tools and platforms such as SQL Server, R, Pandas, Access, Excel, and others for the creation, maintenance, and analysis of large datasets Assisting with the creation of maps, reports, dashboards, presentations, and other materials to succinctly display and summarize relevant data and communicate the results of analyses Using basic knowledge of online mapping platforms and tools such as ArcGIS Online to distribute data and maps to external users as appropriate. Using basic knowledge of scripting languages commonly associated with GIS and data analysis such as Python, ArcPy, R, SQL, and others to automate and streamline analysis tasks Assisting with data maintenance operations including gathering, cleaning, geocoding, and integrating data from multiple sources; compiling, inventorying, and maintaining databases; and converting data to and from various formats Conducting assisted research that includes external communication and, on rare occasions, fieldwork Assisting with the evaluation of information and data from outside sources to determine the quality of input data sources Staying current on GIS and data analysis technologies and techniques through interaction with other professionals and review of industry literature Coordinating with internal and external stakeholders Required Skills Basic to intermediate knowledge of fundamental GIS principles and the ESRI ArcGIS platform, including manipulation of GIS datasets, spatial analysis, and interactive online mapping applications Ability to manipulate and analyze large datasets using a variety of analysis tools including but not limited to ArcGIS Working knowledge of at least one common programming/scripting language used in data analysis, including but not limited to Python, ArcPy, Pandas, R, or SQL Knowledge of basic principles of cartography and demonstrated ability to create mapping products for a variety of audiences Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook Detail-oriented, organized, and able to handle multiple tasks and tight deadlines Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Must be able to work independently and in a team environment Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in analytical, quantitative methods One year of job-related experience or less Starting Salary Range Minimum of $48,030.00 - $57,636.00 annually NCTCOG is a voluntary association of, by and for local governments, and was established to assist local governments in planning for common needs, cooperating for mutual benefit, and coordinating for sound regional development. NCTCOG's purpose is to strengthen both the individual and collective power of local governments and to help them recognize regional opportunities, eliminate unnecessary duplication, and make joint decisions. Since 1974, NCTCOG has served as the Metropolitan Planning Organization for transportation in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metropolitan Area and is responsible for developing transportation plans and programs that address the complex needs of the rapidly growing area. The planning area for transportation includes the 12 counties of Collin, Dallas, Denton, Ellis, Hood, Hunt, Johnson, Kaufman, Parker, Rockwall, Tarrant, and Wise. The agency offers generous benefits, a friendly atmosphere with open communications for cooperative decision making, and challenging opportunities. The environment encourages both individual and team growth, responsibility, and innovation. NCTCOG is recognized as a military-friendly employer and values the knowledge, experience, and skills acquired during your military service career. All qualified veterans are invited to apply. Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: NCTCOG is an equal opportunity employer/program. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other classifications covered under federal, state, or local laws. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities. Background Check & Drug Testing: All selected candidates must undergo a pre-employment background check and drug screening. Background checks include national criminal background check, employment history, motor vehicle record check, social security verification, education verification, and other elements as needed. NCTCOG is committed to a safe and drug free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing. All new hires are required to undergo a drug test which detects the presence of illegal drugs for months prior to testing. We appreciate your cooperation in keeping NCTCOG safe and drug free. In order to receive an offer of employment from NCTCOG, selected candidates must successfully pass the pre-employment background check and drug screening. E-Verify: The North Central Texas Council of Governments participates in the federal E-Verify program in order to verify a new employee's authorization to work in the United States. Applicants must be lawfully authorized to work in the U.S. Job postings are kept open for a minimum of 10 calendar days and may close anytime thereafter at the discretion of the hiring manager. To be considered, candidates must apply directly through our agency's career board at www.nctcog.org/careers. This position is key to McLane's inbound freight practices and the overall financial performance of the Vantix Logistics business. The Business Analyst focuses on freight conversion activities (35%), analytical activities (35%), and reporting and process ownership (30%). Provide support for developing strategies to manage new business opportunities and improve current processes. Analyze data and communicate findings to Vantix pricing, suppliers, and foodservice pricing teams. Negotiate directly with McLane suppliers and restaurants regarding freight pricing. Assist the Pricing Manager with ad-hoc analysis related to quarterly bid updates, annual customer freight bids, new customer freight implementation, and other types of project-related work. Provide lane-level potential revenue feedback for backhaul conversions. This position has additional duties; special projects may be assigned. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Transportation, Logistics, Business, or a related field. 1+ year of logistics management or related work experience. Understanding of business logistics and supply chain management, including transportation, distribution, and customer service. Microsoft Office skills (Access, Excel, Word). Able to travel (up to 10%). Candidates may be subject to a background check and drug screen, in accordance with applicable laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Position: Business Analyst, Plano TX Job Type: Full-time Salary: DOE Job Summary: Manage the relationship between the business units and customer stakeholders/Project managers, ensure business objectives are being met by defining requirements to address short and long term solutions, and validate changes in business processes are implemented well and quality field level training is completed. From a support perspective, it is expected that research will be conducted on reported or assigned incidents with interim and permanent solutions implemented or recommended as system changes. Responsibilities: Other duties may be assigned. A teammate in this position must have the ability to: Manage the relationship between the business units and designated account managers. Be responsible for the elicitation of business requirements and subsequent creation of a business requirements document. Ensure changes, updates and exceptions are documented throughout the project life cycle. Work under the supervision of Senior Business Analyst when learning new areas of focus within the company. Create work flows, swim lanes, mock screens or screens and other visual aids to demonstrate how the solution should be created. Collaborate with development and SME’s to establish the vision of a project and analyze the tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Prepare cost benefit analysis and ROI research to ensure projects submitted are providing proper returns to the company. Obtain approval of the business requirements documents from the business within the project timeline. Provide weekly status reporting to ensure everyone included in the project has an understanding of major milestones, timelines, and whether assigned projects are on track to meeting expected delivery dates. Create adhoc or snapshot reports to aid the business by providing information and working to define long-term solutions where needed. Develop training material as well as maintenance of existing material so business users have an understanding of the systems and solutions that are in place. Facilitate of meetings as needed. Ability to work on many different assignments at one time with demonstrated follow through, attention to detail and commitment to customer service. Ability to work in stressful situations where time demands are high and have the ability to discern priorities. Strong business acumen Ability to travel to divisions to support in upgrades, new implementations, creation or opening of new divisions. Real Estate Valuation Analyst - Invesco - job post Altus Group 142 reviews Dallas, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Category: Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! Altus Group is currently looking for a new Real Estate Valuation Analyst. This position is dedicated to client services and is located in the Dallas offices of Invesco Real Estate. In this position, you will be responsible for all financial analysis for every property within the client portfolios assigned to the analyst. Specific analyses include valuation, asset management, disposition, lease and historical performance analysis. Other responsibilities include the assisting asset management and portfolio management with the external appraisal process and ad hoc analysis. Group Description: The Valuations Group performs all financial analysis for Invesco Real Estate’s US direct real estate portfolio, valued at over $31 billion. The group performs the processes for establishing fair market values for the underlying assets through third party appraisals and internal valuations. These valuations are required for financial reporting, client reporting, and performance benchmarking. The primary property types include office, retail, industrial, and multi-family. The independent group is tasked with the execution of a process designed to value assets with as much objectivity as possible. An important part of the function is to balance the competing perspectives of investment professionals involved in the internal processes to ensure that supportable data is the primary consideration in deriving unbiased valuations. This work is necessary for all of the Advisor’s product lines including open end funds, closed end value add funds, closed end strategic opportunistic funds, an open-end debt fund, and separate account clients. Understanding the structure and investment premises of these funds and their underlying assets will be critical to providing quality work. Key Responsibilities: Perform financial modeling such as discounted cash flow for unleveraged structures. Coordinate with all levels of management to gather and analyze data, summarize findings, and prepare recommendations regarding conclusions. Facilitate the third-party appraisal process as directed by client requirements, including reviewing and auditing the appraisals and writing review comments with market support for findings. Present valuation analyses and assumptions to senior members of asset management and portfolio management. Other duties as assigned. Position Requirements: BA or BS required in Finance, Real Estate, Accounting or Economics, or an area with real estate related coursework Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in the financial analysis of commercial real estate investments and/or appraisal services Intermediate Argus and Excel skills preferred Self-motivated, team oriented and strong time management skills to prioritize deadlines Excellent organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills is essential Must have general grasp of understanding the inputs and outputs of a property-level cash flow Come realize your potential at Altus Group!
